Living Spring International Pittsburgh is a dynamic, vibrant, Holy Spirit led church, where Christ is exalted and worshiped in spirit and truth. We believe in the power of the grace of God for transformation and living a Christ-centered, godly life.

We are a bible believing church and all are welcome to partake in the goodness of God that we daily enjoy here. We are committed to serving God while helping people in the the community to know through what we do how a Christian should live. Here we strive to bring help, hope and healing to every man we come in contact with. We encourage you to come and witness this first hand, and may God bless you as you come and worship with us.

RCCG Streams of Praise is a tabernacle where folks come to encounter Jesus and engage in life-transforming activities. Ours is a safe haven for those who seek solace under the warming arms of our Lord and savior Jesus Christ. We help folks discover their gifts and use them for God‚Äôs glory. You are very welcome to fellowship with us on any of our service days, but much more than that, you are indeed needed and encouraged to be a part of a great end time movement.

Overall, it paints Pittsburgh as a city with charm, grit, and plenty of personality

The piece is geared toward helping potential movers weigh Pittsburgh‚Äôs charm and quirks before settling in.

Summary: Each year many young Students leave their homes across Africa to pursue high education at many of the area's fine colleges and universities. From dealing with the region's changing four seasons to managing the cultures shock, these young men and women face many challenges, Families back home sometimes put up entire life savings to give a child a chance at a better education in America. At PAAPO many of our members have stories of similar experiences. We understand the challenges and know the financial commitment our families make to see us through college. Our members believe in giving back. As part of our annual Scholarship Drive this year, we will give back to a few of the most deserving of our young brothers and sisters from Africa. Our gift may be small but be meaningful. it will show that as Africans and friends of Africa we do care. The financial donations a few students receive will go to defray the cost of books, or meals. It will help alleviate the financial burden placed on families back home

edX is an open online-course provider founded by MIT and Harvard. The courses consist of online videos and textbooks, as well as a discussion space where learners can ask questions to teaching assistants or one another.

360training is a leader in regulatory-approved online training and certification across a wide range of industries and professions in the United States. With more than 11 million users worldwide, its integrated strategy of content, regulatory rigor, technology, and service helps organizations and professionals qualify for jobs, manage their careers, and ensure they fulfill compliance requirements.

Offers a social online learning platform for educators and institutions to design and deliver courses, utilizing project-based activities, collaborative tools, and peer feedback across a wide range of professional and academic subjects. It aims to transform online education into an active, community-driven experience, empowering educators to create engaging courses that build real-world skills.

Udacity is a global online education provider that focuses on "Nanodegree" programs and courses in high-demand technical fields like artificial intelligence, data science, programming, and cybersecurity. It partners with leading tech companies to design a curriculum of real-world, project-based learning. This approach aims to equip students with the practical, job-ready skills needed to launch new careers or advance in their current roles, with a focus on delivering tangible career outcomes for its learners.

Skillshare is a paid online learning community that offers thousands of classes on a wide range of creative and professional skills, including illustration, design, photography, business, and more. Taught by industry experts, its courses are project-based, allowing students to learn by doing and share their work with a community for feedback and collaboration. It aims to empower people to advance their careers, improve their lives, and explore their passions through a subscription-based model.

Broadband Assistance Programs
in Pennsylvania for Low-Income Households

The Downtown Rent Abatement Program (DRAP) aims to foster the development of new, independent businesses in Downtown Pittsburgh, building on existing retail destination clusters or filling needed gaps in retail offerings. Businesses must have a potential location identified and be in active lease negotiations at the time of submitting the application.  This program is designed to assist new businesses that are actively pursuing a location within Downtown Pittsburgh by offering a rent subsidy. This competitive program accepts applications on a rolling basis, and not all applicants are guaranteed funding. The program provides a subsidy of up to 50% of the monthly rent, capped at a maximum of $2,000 per month for 12 months, with a multi-year lease.
